metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12617 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When running Apache Tomcat versions 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0, 8.5.0 to 8.5.22, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.46 and 7.0.0 to 7.0.81 with HTTP PUTs enabled (e.g. via setting the readonly initialisation parameter of the Default servlet to false) it was possible to upload a JSP file to the server via a specially crafted request. This JSP could then be requested and any code it contained would be executed by the server.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12617` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.1-java - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
libtomcat8-embed-java - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
libtomcat8-java - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
tomcat8 - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-admin - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-common - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-examples - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-user - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
tomcat8 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.5.30-1ubuntu1').
